result.execSummary:
The defendant David Arnold Belille Jr. was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. David Arnold Belille Jr. is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • David Arnold Belille Jr. was found guilty of Criminal Damage to Property, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant David Arnold Belille in court with attorney Paul Max Moldenhauer.  Defendant David Arnold Belille in custody.  Bruce Robert Poquette appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
State addresses court. Argues for 6 months consecutive to 6 months in 15CM272. 
Atty Moldenhauer argues sentence. Def addresses court. Court addresses def. 
Court imposes:  6 months county jail with Huber priviledges. Must comply with all Huber requirements. Complete any counseling deemed appropriate by agent. Credit for 36 days served. (Roll-over from 15CM28) Judgment to be taken on costs. Remanded to Sawyer County Jail.

Defendant David Arnold Belille in court.  Bruce Robert Poquette appeared for the State of Wisconsin. DEF states he wants to represent himself. Court addresses DEF. 
SAR postponed to give time for def to contact Public Defender's office.  Sentence adjustment review scheduled for November 29, 2016 at 01:00 pm.

AMENDED
Emailed to Attys and Judge Harrington
Sentence adjustment review on October 31, 2016 at 01:00 pm.
to Modify condiitons of probation - add 30 days jail with out huber

DE advised of rights and penalties; DE waives rights; parties stipulate to facts, DEF pleads NC to CT#1 found guilty, Court withholds sentence 2 years probation  consecutive to 15cm99 -  conditions of probation costs $453.00 no contact with Whitney Davis, Nicole Beaulieu, Tiffany Billyboy, Justin Picchietti  or Marissa Wade,   complete any counseling deemed appropriate by agent
Dismiss CT#2
